intro: Ononis antiquorum var. hirsuta, commonly known as hairy bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hairy bedstraw is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sunny to partially shaded environments.
